experience.experience: • Working as a Senior Software Engineer for Client Onboarding Solutions Team @ Paychex HQ at Rochester, NY

• POSDA: POSDA is an open source application for the archival and curation of DICOM datasets. After receiving the data from submitters our curation teams use POSDA to perform additional quality checks and ensure all data was completely de-identified. It allows users to import DICOM data while tracking date and time received. Users can also prioritize multiple data submission streams based on assigned priority, identify, and resolve duplicate unique identifiers (UIDs) submitted with different image or metadata, and check and edit data for DICOM conformance, consistency, and referential integrity.

◦ Implemented Spring-JDBC template for persistence CRUD operations.
◦ Converted a monolithic app to microservices architecture using Spring Boot. Developed Spring Boot application, which includes the development of producing and consumption of RESTful web services to verify the customer eligibility for the applied insurance policy.
◦ Created event driven jobs using AWS like DynamoDB, SQS and AWS Lambda with Java. Used Git for version control/Source code repository, JIRA for issue/defect tracking and project management.

We will discuss the foundations of data models, transaction models, storage, indexing and querying methods for these data management systems.

projects.shortInfo:
• Developed following REST endpoints for ingestion from: http://mocker.egen.academy/
• Load vehicle details in bulk via a PUT /vehicles endpoint.
• If the vehicle with same VIN is already present, update the regard in db.
• Ingest readings from these vehicles via POST readings .
• Create alerts with given priority when following rules are triggered:
-Rule: engineRpm > readlineRpm , Priority: HIGH
-Rule: fuelVoLume < 10% of maxFuelVolume , Priority: MEDIUM
-Rule: tire pressure of any tire < 32psi | > 36psi , Priority: LOW
-Rule: engineCoolantLow = true || checkEngineLightOn = true , Priority: LOW
• Develop ability to send an email and SMS to the user when HIGH alerts are triggered for a vehicle (AWS SES).
• Develop REST end points for:
-Fetch details of all the vehicles like VIN, make, model, year etc.
-Fetch HIGH alerts within last 2 hours for all the vehicles and ability to sort list of vehicles based on it.
-Ability to list vehicle's geolocation within last 30minutes on a map.
-Ability to list a vehicle's all historical alerts.
• Dockerfile and Jenkinsfile support.
• SwaggerUI support.

This project aims to improve the efficacy of fraudulent transaction alerts for millions of people around the world, helping businesses reduce their fraud loss and increase their revenue. The project uses Python Data Science Libraries like NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Scikit-learn. It also involves benchmarking of machine learning models on a challenging large scale dataset, provided by Vesta's real-world e-commerce transactions.

SHARK2 is a large vocabulary shorthand writing system for pen-based computers. This method of speed-writing for pen-based computing utilizes gesturing on a stylus keyboard for familiar words and tapping for others. The project involves decoding an user input gesture and outputting the best decoded word, given a dictionary containing 10k words using the SHARK2 algorithm.

A small, local chain of retail stores had graciously made its market basket data available to us for analysis. This data consists of records of several million sales, over several years, of tens of thousands of different products.The primary goal of this project is to provide the company with insights that will help them with their business, like (1) which products to promote, (2) which products to place near other products, (3) which products to stock, or (4) which to recommend to specific customers.

projects.projectTitle: Statistical Analysis and Significance Testing using R on Menu Types
projects.shortInfo: This project involves performing Analysis of Variance (ANOVA), Multivariate Analysis of Variance (MANOVA), and pairwise t-tests on datasets comprising of user ids, type of menu, time and error. The aim is to check for statistical significance in between-group and within-subject designs, using R.

projects.projectTitle: Ames Housing Prices: Advanced Regression Techniques
projects.shortInfo: Ask a home buyer to describe their dream house, and they probably won't begin with the height of the basement ceiling or the proximity to an east-west railroad. But this project's dataset proves that much more influences price negotiations than the number of bedrooms or a white-picket fence.With 79 explanatory variables describing (almost) every aspect of residential homes in Ames, Iowa, this project involves predicting the final price of each home.

This project uses the MapReduce programming model to perform various analysis of different stocks of the New York Stock Exchange. It uses Hadoop, and takes as input, an exported CSV file containing all the data. The program takes 6 positional arguments, namely, start and end dates of our interval of interest, aggregation operator on the data obtained for the interval, name of the value field we want to aggregate, the name of the input file in HDFS and the HDFS path for the output. The output has the aggregate value for each stock (i.e. each ticker).

In a stackable file system, each VFS-based object in the stackable file system (e.g., in Wrapfs) has a link to one other object in the lower file system (sometimes called the 'hidden' object). We identify this symbolically as X->X' where 'X' is an object in the upper layer, and X' is an object in the lower layer. This form of stacking is a single-layer linear stacking. When we modify a file in traditional Unix file systems, there's no way to undo or recover a previous version of that file. There's also no way to get older versions of the same file. Being able to access a history of versions of file changes is very useful, to recover lost or inadvertent changes. This project's aim is to create a file system that automatically creates backup versions of files, and also allows us to view versions as well as recover them. This Backup File System (bkpfs) will have to handle several tasks via policies that has been designed, appropriate justifications has been provided for the design, implemented, and tested: backup, version access, and retention policies.

Encrypting files is very useful and important nowadays, but many OSs do not support this feature natively (yet). This project is to create a Linux kernel module in vanilla 4.20 Linux that, when loaded into Linux, will support a new system call that can takes an input file, encrypts  decrypts, or simply copies it, and then produce an output file.

This project deals with the classical Word Count problem of MapReduce. This advanced version involves removal of punctuation and stop words (Stop Words taken from a file), case-sensitive switch and also allows the user to select the number of map and reduce tasks. It allows multiple input files and accepts case-sensitive switch(on/off), number of map reduce tasks and the HDFS input file and HDFS output file as positional arguments. It segregates the word count in a single output file, irrespective of the number of input files.

This project deals with the design and building of a Customer to Customer (C2C) Web Application, which serves as a bridge between the donors and the welfare organizations. The main technologies involved are Java Server Pages (JSP) and Oracle 11g as the Database.

This projects deals with the design and building of an Auction Management E-Commerce Portal. The key technologies used to develop this are PHP and MySQL. The system has a multitude of features like login through social platforms, grid and list views, dashboard page, auction search page (implementing Facets), admin panel (with Ajax), Lightbox to display the images, automatic time extension to avoid snipping, add to watchlist, bulk import and reverse auction.

summary:
Hello, I'm Kaustav, a Computer Science enthusiast and currently working as a Senior Software Engineer at Paychex,Inc. I have a Masters in Computer Science and Bachelors in Information Technology. I also have about 5 years of experience as a Software Engineer in IT industry.

I'm ardent about programming and delivering, clean, test-covered, well-designed and scalable code. My aim has always been to learn new technologies and apply them.

I have a strong hold on Computer Science fundamentals including Algorithms, Data Structures, OOPs, Design Patterns, Operating Systems, Database Systems and Computer Networking. I am a firm believer of the fact that the key to being a successful programmer is to learn how to learn a technology than to learn a technology.
qoutes: Technology, like art, is a soaring exercise of the human imagination.
You only live as long as the last person who remembers you.
Every day every hour turn the pain into power.
If you cannot be a pencil to write someone's happiness, then try to be an eraser to erase someone's sorrows.
The real danger is not that computers will begin to think like humans, but that humans will begin to think like computers.
Great things never come from comfort zones.
If you fight for your dreams, one day your dreams will fight for you.
Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Wishing is not enough, we must do.
What you lack in talent can be made up with desire, hustle and giving 110% all the time.
The pain you feel today will be the strength you feel tomorrow.
helloText:
Dear Visitor, a warm welcome to my webspace.

Are you hiring?
If Yes, I'm always on the lookout for fantastic opportunities with SDE roles. Explore this space, and if you think I can be a good fit, give me an opportunity to interview with you. Here's my resume for your perusal.

I'm currently working at Paychex,Inc. at their HQ in Rochester,NY after recently graduating with a Master of Science degree in Computer Science from Stony Brook University, New York. Previously, I completed my B.Tech in Information Technology from Techno India College of Technology, under West Bengal University of Technology.

I am a Java back end developer, and highly skilled in Core Java and Java frameworks like Spring along with Spring Boot, Spring Security, Spring MVC, Spring Batch and Spring Cloud to name a few . I am also an Amazon Web Services (AWS) enthusiast, with the motivation of becoming an end-to-end developer. I love to code in Java, Python as well as in C.

How can I be of your help?
Well, I can design, develop and deliver optimal solutions to your technological problems.

So did you find something in common? If so, let's talk about it and grow together.

Didn't find anything in common?
That's not a problem, I am open to learning new things so please introduce me to something that I'm missing.
